availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Wright North South East West (Clark County, Kentucky.)

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, tailor and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Eliza Sweeny West in Monroe County, Missouri, on July 23, 1846. Father of Sarah West, Nannie West, and Frances West. Tailor in Clark County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Clark County in 1850. Farmer in Clark County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Clark County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 42B.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 336B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Winchester, p. 131B.
Missouri, U.S., Marriage Records, 1805-2002, Missouri State Archives, Jefferson City, MO, Monroe County, p. 225.
